summary: This document is a chain of emails from late June to early July 2019 discussing the scheduling of a conference call among FBI and other personnel to coordinate victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show logistical planning for a call involving the FBI's Child Victim Services Unit and the New York Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force.

connections.description: Both are copied on internal FBI emails coordinating a conference call about Epstein victim interviews, indicating they work together on the case.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: A conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case. The call involved FBI personnel from the Child Victim Services Unit and the NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force.

events.title: Hospitalization of participant affects call plans
events.description: One participant emails that they are in the hospital and would only be able to call in, indicating a change in participation mode for the scheduled meeting.

events.title: SDNY meeting and ADIC case brief
events.description: Reference to a 2:30 meeting with an unspecified person and their team at the Southern District of New York (SDNY) on a wider variety of subjects, and a separate case brief requested by the ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) at 3:30 PM.

locations: Seattle (mentioned as travel location for one participant)
keyFacts: The FBI's Child Victim Services Unit and Violent Crimes Task Force were actively coordinating victim interviews in the Epstein case in late June 2019.
A conference call was specifically scheduled for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss Epstein victim interviews.
One participant was hospitalized on July 1, 2019, affecting their ability to attend in person but still offering to call in.
The emails reference a separate meeting at SDNY and a case brief requested by the ADIC, indicating multi-agency coordination.
The document shows the operational planning and logistical challenges in organizing investigative efforts in the Epstein case.
